entry.title: Komeng (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 2024 election, Indonesian comedian Komeng (election portrait pictured) received the most votes of any senatorial candidate to date?

entry.title: Selected Ambient Works 85–92 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Selected Ambient Works 85–92's audio quality has been described as poor due to being recorded on a cassette damaged by a cat?

entry.title: Merrill Piepkorn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that North Dakota state senator Merrill Piepkorn is also a musician, radio host, and public address announcer?

entry.title: Cladonota (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cladonota's extravagant dorsal structures have been called both "grotesque" and "particularly charismatic"?

entry.title: Joseph Schwarz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in opposition to his parents, opera star Joseph Schwarz began his career by running away from home to join a band of traveling minstrels?

entry.title: an unusual mountain (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an unusual mountain on Pluto may have once erupted water instead of lava?

entry.title: Audrys Nin Reyes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Audrys Nin Reyes is the first male gymnast from the Dominican Republic to qualify for the Olympic Games?

entry.title: copyright has been used to censor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that copyright has been used to censor reporters, activists, scholars and artists?

entry.title: an abandoned Catholic church in China (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an abandoned Catholic church in China was used by a party school?
